description:
Cardinal Jorge Mario Bergoglio of Argentina was elected pope on March 13, 2013, at the age of 76. The 266th pontiff of the Roman Catholic Church, he is the first Jesuit and the first to take the name Francis. He is also the first non-European leader of the church in more than 1,200 years. 
Full coverage on Pope Francis’ visit to Washington, New York and Philadelphia in September, his first ever to the United States.
title: Pope Francis
title_page: Pope Francis - The New York Times
maintext:
Pope Francis Says Arming Ukraine Can Be ‘Morally Acceptable.’
The pontiff said that it is acceptable for countries to provide weapons to Ukraine so that the country can defend itself, but stressed that communication channels with Russia should remain open.
